summary.long: Zechariah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the eighth month, during the second year of King Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Zechariah, son of Berekiah, son of Iddo, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was very angry with your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so you will say to them, Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Return to Me, and I will return to you, says the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be like your fathers to whom the former prophets cried, “Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Turn away from your evil ways and deeds!” But they did not listen or pay attention to Me, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So where are your fathers, and do the prophets live forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely My words and statutes that I commanded to My servants, the prophets, did they not persuade your fathers?
They turned back and said, “Whatever the Lord of Hosts planned to do to us according to our ways and deeds, so He has done to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twenty-fourth day, in the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, during the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Zechariah, son of Berekiah, son of Iddo:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw during the night a man riding on a red horse. But he was standing among the myrtle trees that were in the ravine, and behind him were red, sorrel, and white horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said, “What are these, my lord?”
Then the angel who was speaking with me said, “I will show you what these are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man who was standing among the myrtle trees responded and said, “These are the ones whom the Lord has sent out to walk to and fro on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to the angel of the Lord who was standing among the myrtle trees, “We have gone to and fro on the earth, and all the earth is resting and peaceful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord said, “How much longer, O Lord of Hosts, will You withhold mercy from Jerusalem and the cities of Judah with which You have been angry these seventy years?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord answered the angel speaking to me with good and comforting words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the angel who spoke with me said, Cry out, saying: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: I have a great jealousy for Jerusalem and Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have a great anger for those nations who are at ease, for while I was angry but a little, they helped to increase evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: I have returned to Jerusalem with mercy, and My house will be built in it, says the Lord of Hosts, and a measuring line will be stretched over Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry out again, saying, Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Yet again My cities will overflow with goodness, and again the Lord will comfort Zion and choose Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I then lifted up my eyes, and I saw four horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said to the angel speaking to me, “What are these?”
And he answered, “These are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord showed me four craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said, “What are these coming to do?”
And he said, “These are the horns that scattered Judah after which no one could raise his head; and these four craftsmen have come to terrify and throw down the horns of the nations who lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I lifted up my eyes, and I saw a man with a measuring cord in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said, “Where are you going?”
And he responded, “To measure Jerusalem and to note what is its width and length.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel who was speaking with me went out, and then another angel came out to meet him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Run, say to this young man: Jerusalem will be inhabited as villages without walls, because of the multitude of men and animals in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will be like a wall of fire all around her, says the Lord, and I will be as glory in her midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up, up, flee from the northern land, says the Lord, for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deliver yourself, O Zion, you who live with the daughter of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of Hosts: He has sent Me after glory to the nations which plunder you, for he who touches you touches the apple of His eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will swing My hand against them, and they will become plunder for their servants. Then you will know well that the Lord of Hosts has sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion, for I am coming and will dwell in your midst, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many nations will join themselves with the Lord in that day, and they will be My people. And I will reside in your midst, and you will know that the Lord of Hosts has sent Me to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will possess Judah as His portion in the holy land, and He will again choose Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be still, all flesh before the Lord, for He is stirred from His holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he showed me Joshua, the high priest, standing before the angel of the Lord, and Satan standing at his right hand to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Satan, “The Lord rebuke you, Satan! The Lord who has chosen Jerusalem rebukes you! Is this not a burning brand taken out of the fire?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua had on filthy garments and was standing before the angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to those standing before him, “Take off his filthy garments.”
Then he said, “See that I have removed from you your iniquity, and I will clothe you with rich robes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, “Let them place a pure turban on his head.” So they put a pure turban on his head and garments on him. And the angel of the Lord was standing by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord admonished Joshua, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of Hosts: If you walk in My ways and keep My charge, then you will judge My house and guard My courts, and I will give to you access to these who are standing here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear this, O Joshua the high priest, you and your friends sitting before you, for these men are a sign. I am bringing My servant, the Branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stone that I have set before Joshua, on that single stone is seven eyes. And I will engrave an inscription, says the Lord of Hosts, and I will remove the iniquity of this land in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day, says the Lord of Hosts, each of you will invite your companion to come and sit under the vine and under the fig tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel who was speaking with me returned and woke me up like a man who is roused from his sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to me, “What do you see?”
And I responded, “I see a completely gold lampstand and a bowl at its top, with seven lights on it, and seven pipes on it for each lamp in order to light them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there are two olive trees next to it, one on the right of the bowl and one on the left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I answered and I asked the angel speaking with me, “What are these, my lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the angel speaking with me responded, “Do you really not know what these are?”
And I said, “No, my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me: “This is the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel, saying: Not by might nor by power, but by My Spirit, says the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who are you, O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you will be made level ground, and he will bring out the top stone amidst shouting of ‘Grace! Grace to the stone!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The hands of Zerubbabel have established the foundation of this house, and they will even complete it. Then you will know that the Lord of Hosts has sent Me to all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For who has despised the day of small things? These seven will rejoice and see the plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. These are the eyes of the Lord, which survey to and fro throughout the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I answered and I asked, “What are these two olives trees on the right and left of the lampstand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I asked a second time, “What are these two branches of the olive trees that are next to the two golden pipes from which they pour out the gold oil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he asked me, “Do you not know what these are?”
I responded, “No, my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “These are the two anointed ones who stand by the Lord of all the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I turned and lifted up my eyes and saw a flying scroll.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked me, “What do you see?”
And I responded, “I see a flying scroll with its length as twenty cubits and its width as ten cubits.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “This is the curse going out over the surface of all the land. Everyone who steals will be purged according to the writing on one side, and everyone who swears falsely will be purged according to the writing on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send it out, says the Lord of Hosts, and it will enter the house of the thief, and the house of him who swears falsely by My name. It will remain in his house and consume it, with its timber and stones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel who was speaking with me came out, saying, “Now lift up your eyes and see what this is that is going forth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I asked, “What is it?”
He said, “This is the ephah basket going forth. This represents their iniquity throughout all the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lead cover was lifted, and there was a woman sitting in the ephah basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “This is wickedness.” And he threw her back into the basket and then thrust back the lead stone over its opening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I lifted my eyes and saw coming forward two women. There was wind in their wings, and the wings were like those of a stork, and they lifted up and carried the ephah basket between heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to the angel who was speaking with me, “Where are they carrying the basket?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He responded, “To build a house for it in the land of Shinar. And when the house is established, the basket will be set there on a pedestal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I turned around and lifted my eyes, and I saw four chariots coming out from between two mountains, which were bronze mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first chariot had red horses, the second black horses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third white horses, and the fourth chariot dappled horses—all of them strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I answered the angel speaking with me, “What are these, my lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel responded, “These are the four winds of heaven going out after standing before the Lord of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one with the black horses is going toward the north country, the white ones are going after them, while the dappled ones are going toward the south country.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the strong horses went out, they were seeking to go to and fro throughout the earth. And he said, “Go out to and fro throughout the earth.” And they went out to walk to and fro throughout the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cried out to me, “Look, the ones going out to the northern land have given rest to my Spirit in the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take from the exiles Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah who have come from Babylon, and go on that day to the house of Josiah, the son of Zephaniah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the silver and gold and make a crown, and set it on the head of Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to him: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Here is a man whose name is Branch; for he shall branch out from his place, and he shall build the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is he who shall build the temple of the Lord; he shall bear the glory, and shall sit and rule on his throne. He shall be a priest on his throne, and the counsel of peace shall be between them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crown shall be for a memorial to Helem, Tobijah, Jedaiah, and Hen the son of Zephaniah, in the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who are far off shall come and help to build the temple of the Lord; and you all shall know that the Lord of Hosts has sent me to you. This shall happen if you diligently obey the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fourth year of King Darius, on the fourth day of the ninth month, Kislev, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in Bethel sent Sharezer and Regem-Melek and their men to entreat the graces of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to the priests and prophets of the house of the Lord of Hosts, “Should I weep and dedicate myself during the fifth month as I have done in these many years?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to all the people in the land and to the priests: When you fasted and lamented during the fifth and seventh months for these seventy years, did you really fast for Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you eat and when you drink, do you not eat and drink for yourselves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were these not the very words that the former prophets proclaimed when Jerusalem dwelled with ease along with her surrounding cities, and when the Negev and the Lowland were inhabited?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to Zechariah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Execute true justice, show mercy and compassion, every man to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not oppress the widow, orphan, sojourner, or poor. And let none of you contemplate evil deeds in your hearts against his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they refused to pay attention and turned a stubborn shoulder, and stopped their ears so that they should not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made their hearts hard like a diamond so as not to hear the instruction and words that the Lord of Hosts sent by His Spirit through the former prophets, and there was great anger from the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it happened that as I called, and they would not hear, so they called, and I would not hear, says the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I scattered them about among all the nations whom they did not know, so the land was left desolate behind them with no one coming or going. And they made a desirable land desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: I am exceedingly jealous for Zion, and with great wrath I am jealous for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: I have returned to Zion and will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem, and Jerusalem will be called a city of faithfulness and the mountain of the Lord of Hosts, the holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Older men and women will again sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each having a staff in his hand because of advanced age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the plazas of the city will be filled with young boys and girls playing in her open places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, will it also be marvelous in My eyes? says the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: I will deliver My people from the eastern lands and from the western lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring them, and they will reside in Jerusalem, and they will be for Me as a people, and I will be for them as God, with faithfulness and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Let your hands be strengthened, whoever is hearing these words in these days, from the mouth of the prophets who were there in the day that the house of the Lord of Hosts was founded, that the temple might be built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before those days there were no wages for a man nor any hire for an animal; and there was no peace from an enemy for him who went out or came in; for I set every man against his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I will not be as in the former days against this remnant people, says the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sowing will be done in peace, and the vine will produce its fruit, and the ground will provide its produce, and the heavens will give their rain. And I will cause the remnant of this people to inherit all of these benefits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as you have been like a curse among the nations, O house of Israel and house of Judah, I will deliver you, and you will be a blessing. Fear not, and strengthen your hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Just as I had determined to punish you when your fathers incited Me to wrath, says the Lord of Hosts, I did not relent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So again have I purposed in these days to do good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do not fear!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things you will do: Speak truth each to his neighbor, and make judgments in your gates that are for truth, and justice, and peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let none of you consider evil plans in your heart against your neighbor, and do not love false oaths, for I hate all these things, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord of Hosts came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: The fast during the fourth and fifth months, and the fasts during the seventh and tenth months, will become rejoicing and joy and pleasant feasts for the house of Judah. So love what brings truth and peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Peoples will still come, even those who live in many cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who live in one city will journey to another, saying, “Let us surely go to seek the Lord of Hosts. I myself am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many peoples and strong nations will seek out the Lord of Hosts in Jerusalem and to entreat the favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: In those days ten men from every language of the nations will take hold of the garment of a Jew, saying, “Let us go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An oracle of the word of the Lord that is against the land of Hadrak,
    and Damascus is the place where it will rest.
For the eyes of men and the tribes of Israel
    are on the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also Hamath borders it,
    even Tyre and Sidon, cities that are very wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tyre has built a rampart for herself
    and stored up silver like it were dust,
    and even gold like it were mud in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will dispossess her of her possessions
    and strike down her power in the sea,
    and she will be devoured with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A mongrel people will dwell in Ashdod,
    and I will cut down the pride of Philistia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take away the bloodshed from its mouth,
    and the abominations from between its teeth.
Even it will be a remnant for our God.
    It will be like a tribe of a clan in Judah,
    and Ekron like the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will make camp at My house with a garrison,
    so that no one can pass back and forth.
And no oppressor will pass through them,
    for now I see with My eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion!
    And cry aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem!
See, your king is coming to you;
    he is righteous and able to deliver,
    he is humble and riding on a donkey,
    a colt, the offspring of a donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And as for you, because of the blood of your covenant,
    I will send your prisoners from the empty, waterless pits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return to your stronghold, prisoners who now have hope.
    Today I declare that I will return to you a double portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I have bent Judah as My bow
    and fitted the bow with Ephraim.
I will stir up your sons, O Zion,
    against your sons, O Greece,
    and will set you like the sword of a warrior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord will appear over them,
    and His arrow will go out like lightning.
The Lord God will sound His trumpet,
    and will march forth like storm winds of southern Teman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of Hosts will protect them.
They will devour up
    and subdue them with stone slingers.
And they will drink and make noise as with wine;
    they will be filled with blood as a bowl,
    saturated like the corners of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord their God will deliver them that day
    like the flock of His people.
For like jewels embedded in a crown,
    they will shine in His land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For how great is His goodness, and how great His beauty!
    There will be grain for the young men
    and new wine to prosper the young women.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the household Teraphim idols speak wickedness,
    and the diviners envision lies.
They utter false dreams,
    and provide comfort that does not last.
So the people wander about like sheep;
    they are afflicted because there is no shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My anger burns against the shepherds,
    and I will visit judgment on the male goats.
For the Lord of Hosts will visit His flock, the house of Judah,
    and will make them like His majestic horse in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From him comes the cornerstone,
    and from him the tent peg.
From him comes the bow for battle,
    and from him every ruler goes out, all these together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they will be as mighty men,
    who trample down in the muddy streets in battle.
They will fight because the Lord is with them,
    and He will put to shame those riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make strong the house of Judah,
    and will deliver the house of Joseph.
I will restore them
    because I have compassion on them.
They will be like
    I had never rejected them;
for I am the Lord their God,
    and I will respond to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Ephraim shall be like a mighty man,
    and their hearts shall rejoice as with wine.
Their children shall see this and be glad;
    their hearts shall rejoice in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will whistle to them
    and gather them in,
for I have ransomed them;
    they will be numerous as they were numerous before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I scatter them among the nations,
    they will remember Me in the distant lands;
they will live with their children
    and then return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring them home from the land of Egypt,
    and gather them from Assyria.
I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon,
    until there is no room for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will pass through the sea of distress,
    and will put down the waves in the sea:
    All the depths of the Nile will be dried up;
and the arrogance of Assyria will be brought down,
    and the scepter of Egypt will turn away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make them strong in the Lord,
    and they will go to and fro in His name,
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your doors, O Lebanon,
    so the fire can consume your cedar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail, O cypress, for the cedar has fallen;
    the majestic trees are destroyed.
Wail, O oaks of Bashan,
    because the unassailable forest has been brought down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is the sound of wailing shepherds,
    because their glory is ruined.
There is the sound of roaring lions,
    because the pride of Jordan is ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord my God: Shepherd the flock of slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones who buy them then slaughter them and have no guilt, and those who sell them say, “Blessed is the Lord because I am rich.” Their own shepherds do not take pity on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will no longer have pity on those who dwell in the land, says the Lord. But I will cause each of them to fall into the hands of his neighbor, even into the hands of his king. They will crush the land, and I will not deliver any from their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I shepherded the flock that was for slaughter, even the afflicted of the flock. And I took for myself two staffs. One I called Favor and the other I gave the name Union. So I pastured the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I destroyed the three shepherds in the span of one month.
For my soul was impatient with them, and their souls detested me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “I will not shepherd you. What is to die, let it die. What is to be destroyed, let it be destroyed. Let those who are left devour each other’s flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took the staff named Favor and cut it into pieces, to break the covenant that I made with all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was broken that day, and the afflicted of the flock were watching me and knew that this was the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to them, “If this is good in your eyes, then give my wages to me, but if not, then keep it.” They weighed my wages at thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Throw it to the potter, the splendid price by which I was valued by them.” So I took the thirty silver pieces and threw them to the house of the Lord to the potter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I cut up the second staff, Union, to break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me: Take for yourself again the vessels carried by a foolish shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am raising up a shepherd in the land who will not care for those who are perishing, nor seek the young, nor heal the broken, nor feed those who are standing still. But he will eat the flesh of the fat and tear their hoofs in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to this worthless shepherd
    who abandons his flock.
May the sword take his arm and right eye;
    may his arm surely wither up,
    and his right eye become blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The oracle of the word of the Lord against Israel.
Thus says the Lord, the One who stretches out the heavens and establishes the earth and forms the spirit of man within him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am going to make Jerusalem a cup of reeling before all the surrounding nations. And when there is a siege against Judah, it is also against Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be on that day that I will set Jerusalem as a weighty stone to all the peoples. All who carry it will surely gash themselves, and all the nations of the land will be gathered against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will strike every horse with confusion and its rider with madness, but for the house of Judah I will keep My eyes open although I will strike with blindness every horse of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the clans of Judah will say in their hearts, “There is strength for us with those residing in Jerusalem by the Lord of Hosts, their God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will set Judah like a fiery pot among wood and as a flaming torch among cut grain. And they will devour to the right and left all the surrounding peoples, while Jerusalem will still reside in her place, the place of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will deliver the tents of Judah as before, so that the glory of the house of David and the glory of those dwelling in Jerusalem will not eclipse Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the Lord will defend those residing in Jerusalem; and even the one who stumbles among them will be as David on that day. And the house of David will be like God, like the angel of the Lord going out before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will seek to destroy all the nations who come out against Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pour out on the house of David and over those dwelling in Jerusalem a spirit of favor and supplication so that they look to Me, whom they have pierced through. And they will mourn over him as one mourns for an only child and weep bitterly over him as a firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the mourning in Jerusalem will be as great as that of Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land will mourn with each family by itself: the family of the house of David by themselves, and their wives by themselves; the family of the house of Nathan by themselves, and their wives by themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the family of the house of Levi by themselves, and their wives by themselves; the family of Shimei by themselves, and their wives also by themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the families that remain, each by itself and their wives by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day there will be a spring opened up for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on that day, says the Lord of Hosts, I will cut off the names of the idols from the land, and they will not be remembered any more. And I will also remove from the land the prophets and the unclean spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be if a man again prophesies, then his father and mother who gave birth to him will say, “You will not live because you speak deception in the name of the Lord.” Then when he prophesies, his father and mother will pierce him through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day each prophet will be ashamed of his vision when he prophesies. He will not put on a robe of coarse hair in order to deceive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will say, “I am not a prophet. I am a man who works the ground, for a man purchased me when I was young.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone asks, “What are these wounds on your arms?” he will say, “I was struck in the house of my close friends.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Awake, O sword, against My shepherd
    and the man of My association,”
    says the Lord of Hosts.
Strike the shepherd,
    and the sheep will scatter.
    I will turn My hand against the small ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it will happen in all the land, says the Lord,
    that two-thirds will be cut off and die,
    and one-third will be left in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will bring this one-third left into the fire,
    and will refine them as the refinement of silver,
    and will test them as the testing of gold.
They will call on My name,
    and I will answer them.
I will say, “They are My people”;
    and they will say, “The Lord is my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A day of the Lord is coming when your spoil will be divided in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will gather all the nations against Jerusalem for battle. The city will be captured and the houses plundered and the women ravished. Half of the city will go to exile, but the remainder of the people will not be cut off from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will go out and fight those nations as He fights in the day of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day His feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, which is to the east of Jerusalem. And from east to west the Mount of Olives will be split in two halves by a very great valley so that one half moves to the north and the other to the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will flee to my mountain valley, for the mountain valley will reach to Azal. You will flee just like you fled from the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. Then the Lord my God will come and all His holy ones with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on that day there will be no light. The lights will diminish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there will be one day known to the Lord, neither during the day nor the night, but at the evening time there will be light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day living water will flow out from Jerusalem, half to the Dead Sea and the other half to the Mediterranean Sea. This will happen for the summer as well as the winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will be king over all the earth. In that day it will be—“The Lord is one,” and His name is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the land will be turned into a plain from Geba to Rimmon to the south of Jerusalem. But Jerusalem will rise and dwell in her place from the Benjamin Gate to the place of the Old Gate, to the Corner Gate, and then from the Tower of Hananel to the winepress of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And people will live there, and she will never again be devoted for destruction. Jerusalem will reside in security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will be the pestilence with which the Lord will strike all the peoples who go to battle against Jerusalem: Their flesh will rot as they stand on their feet, their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on that day a great tumult from the Lord will come on them as each person will seize the hand of his neighbor, and the hand of one will be raised against the hand of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even Judah will fight with Jerusalem, and the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be gathered, a great abundance of gold, silver, and garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this plague will come to horses, mules, camels, donkeys, and any other animals that are in the camp. So will this plague be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it will be that all the nations who have come against Jerusalem and survived will go up each year to worship the King, the Lord of Hosts, and to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will happen that if any of the families of the earth do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord of Hosts, then there will not be rain for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the family of Egypt does not go up and enter in, they shall have no rain. This will be the plague with which the Lord strikes the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations who do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day “HOLY TO THE LORD” will be engraved on the bells of the horses. And the pots in the house of the Lord will be as the basins before the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the Lord of Hosts so that all who come to sacrifice will take from those pots and boil the meat in them. And on that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the Lord of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
